repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR is fixing crashing cython when generator expressions are
used in cdef functions in pure python mode. Fixes #3477.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,6 +55,13 @@ def func(a, b, c):
     """
     return a + b + c
 
+def sum_generator_expression(a):
+    """
+    >>> sum_generator_expression(5)
+    10
+    """
+    return sum(i for i in range(a))

comment_data.body: This is quick and ugly. I left it for most straightforward change.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2488,6 +2488,37 @@ def visit_CClassDefNode(self, node):
         return node
 
 
+class AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions(CythonTransform):
+
+    def visit_ModuleNode(self, node):
+        self.scope = node.scope
+        self.directives = node.directives
+        self.imported_names = set()  # hack, see visit_FromImportStatNode()
+        self.visitchildren(node)
+        return node
+
+    def visit_DefNode(self, node):
+        pxd_def = self.scope.lookup(node.name)
+        if pxd_def and (not pxd_def.scope or not pxd_def.scope.is_builtin_scope):
+            pass

comment_data.body: Just note: The PR currently is not 100% cleaned. I would like to understand whether the approach is fine.

comment_data.body:
The only issue with the "splitting the transforms in half" approach is that each transform takes time to run, so we're trying to avoid too many transforms for small tasks (although I'm a bit guilty of doing that too).

This particular transform looks like it only does a fairly shallow run (it doesn't actually go into functions for example) so it may not be too bad. It should duplicate `visit_ExprNode` from `AlignFunctionDefinitions` though (because it never cares about anything in an expression).

I think it's probably OK (mainly because it can't obviously be merged with any of the neighbouring transforms)...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2488,6 +2488,37 @@ def visit_CClassDefNode(self, node):
         return node
 
 
+class AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions(CythonTransform):
+
+    def visit_ModuleNode(self, node):
+        self.scope = node.scope
+        self.directives = node.directives
+        self.imported_names = set()  # hack, see visit_FromImportStatNode()
+        self.visitchildren(node)
+        return node
+
+    def visit_DefNode(self, node):
+        pxd_def = self.scope.lookup(node.name)
+        if pxd_def and (not pxd_def.scope or not pxd_def.scope.is_builtin_scope):
+            pass

comment_data.body:
Is there a good reason (apart from history) why `auto_cpdef` is ignored in .pyx files? And if there is, then should we warn when someone tries to use it?

It looks to be undocumented so hopefully not too many people are using it of course
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -173,8 +173,10 @@ def create_pipeline(context, mode, exclude_classes=()):
 
     if mode == 'py':
         _align_function_definitions = AlignFunctionDefinitions(context)
+        _auto_cpdef_function_definitions = AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions(context)
     else:
         _align_function_definitions = None
+        _auto_cpdef_function_definitions = None

comment_data.body: Good point. There is no particular reason for that. I have fixed that.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

         _align_function_definitions = AlignFunctionDefinitions(context)
+        _auto_cpdef_function_definitions = AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions(context)
     else:
         _align_function_definitions = None
+        _auto_cpdef_function_definitions = None

@@ -55,6 +55,17 @@ def func(a, b, c):
     """
     return a + b + c
 
+def sum_generator_expression(a):
+    # GH-3477 - closure variables incorrectly captured in functions transformed to cdef
+    return sum(i for i in range(a))
+
+def run_sum_generator_expression(a):
+    """
+    >>> sum_generator_expression(5)

@@ -2496,8 +2496,6 @@ class AlignFunctionDefinitions(CythonTransform):
 
     def visit_ModuleNode(self, node):
         self.scope = node.scope
-        self.directives = node.directives
-        self.imported_names = set()  # hack, see visit_FromImportStatNode()

@@ -2535,16 +2533,32 @@ def visit_DefNode(self, node):
                     error(pxd_def.pos, "previous declaration here")
                 return None
             node = node.as_cfunction(pxd_def)
+        return node
+
+    def visit_ExprNode(self, node):
+        # ignore lambdas and everything else that appears in expressions
+        return node
+
+
+class AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions(AlignFunctionDefinitions):
+
+    def visit_ModuleNode(self, node):
+        self.directives = node.directives
+        self.imported_names = set()  # hack, see visit_FromImportStatNode()
+        return super(AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions, self).visit_ModuleNode(node)
+
+    def visit_DefNode(self, node):
+        pxd_def = self.scope.lookup(node.name)
+        if pxd_def and (not pxd_def.scope or not pxd_def.scope.is_builtin_scope):
+            pass
         elif (self.scope.is_module_scope and self.directives['auto_cpdef']
               and node.name not in self.imported_names
               and node.is_cdef_func_compatible()):
-            # FIXME: cpdef-ing should be done in analyse_declarations()

The rest of the "?"s I agree with

comment_data.body:
I think we should also try to swap these two. The `AdjustDefByDirectives` is highly related to those that follow now.
```suggestion
        WithTransform(context),
        AdjustDefByDirectives(context),
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -188,8 +188,9 @@ def create_pipeline(context, mode, exclude_classes=()):
         ParallelRangeTransform(context),
         AdjustDefByDirectives(context),
         WithTransform(context),

comment_data.body:
I have checked that and compiling following file `cython/Cython/Plex/DFA.py` fails when it is removed:
```
$ python cython.py -3 /home/matus/dev/cython/Cython/Plex/DFA.py

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
    """
    Helper class used by nfa_to_dfa() to map back and forth between
    sets of states from the old machine and states of the new machine.
    """

    def __init__(self, new_machine):
   ^
------------------------------------------------------------

Cython/Plex/DFA.py:100:4: Special methods must be declared with 'def', not 'cdef'

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
    """
    Helper class used by nfa_to_dfa() to map back and forth between
    sets of states from the old machine and states of the new machine.
    """

   ^
------------------------------------------------------------

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
            if priority > best_priority:
                best_action = state.action
                best_priority = priority
        return best_action

   ^
------------------------------------------------------------

Error compiling Cython file:

    def dump(self, file):
   ^
------------------------------------------------------------

Cython/Plex/DFA.py:143:4: C method 'dump' not previously declared in definition part of extension type 'StateMap'

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
    """
    Helper class used by nfa_to_dfa() to map back and forth between

    """

------------------------------------------------------------

Cython/Plex/DFA.py:100:4: Return with value in void function
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2560,6 +2562,19 @@ def visit_DefNode(self, node):
             node = node.as_cfunction(scope=self.scope)
         return node
 
+    def visit_CClassDefNode(self, node, pxd_def=None):
+        if pxd_def is None:
+            pxd_def = self.scope.lookup(node.class_name)
+        if pxd_def:
+            if not pxd_def.defined_in_pxd:
+                return node

comment_data.body: The if statement ` if pxd_def and (not pxd_def.scope or not pxd_def.scope.is_builtin_scope):` is executed in `AlignFunctionDefinitions` transform before `AutoCpdefFunctionDefinition` transform. If it is evaluated as `True` in the `AlignFunctionDefinitions` transform, the function definition is transformed to cfunction and hence in that case the `visit_DefNode()` is not called anymore. So I considered this part as not relevant any more.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2552,10 +2552,7 @@ def visit_ModuleNode(self, node):
         return node
 
     def visit_DefNode(self, node):
-        pxd_def = self.scope.lookup(node.name)
-        if pxd_def and (not pxd_def.scope or not pxd_def.scope.is_builtin_scope):
-            pass
-        elif (self.scope.is_module_scope and self.directives['auto_cpdef']
+        if (self.scope.is_module_scope and self.directives['auto_cpdef']

commit.message:
Execute AlignFunctionDefinitions before MarkClosureTransform.

This commit is fixing crashing cython when generator expressions are
used in cdef functions in pure python mode.

Fix broken sum_generator_expression test

Co-authored-by: da-woods <dw-git@d-woods.co.uk>
Move auto-cpdef functionality to separate Transform.

tree 1dc042e9f1f99285e08d1428ed893987300fecd1
parent b0b628cd6b98a4809e33b496a78539412a7dfc02
author Matus Valo <matusvalo@users.noreply.github.com> 1619505482 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1619505482 +0200

Update tests/run/pure_pxd.srctree

Co-authored-by: da-woods <dw-git@d-woods.co.uk>

commit.message: AutoCpdefFunctionDefinitions defines visit_CClassDefNode instead of inheriting from AlignFunctionDefinitions
See if moving the `AdjustDefByDirectives` transform right before the other adjustement transforms works as it should.

verification.payload:
tree 19461e4d5ac01138c5670f9ac302f2873d6bb1ab
parent ed0872e5142f87bc5b66c6b8685ec23c16c3aec1
author scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de> 1619865492 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1619865492 +0200

See if moving the `AdjustDefByDirectives` transform right before the other adjustement transforms works as it should.
